body: There is a fix made to read external component value: https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/issues/1090

you will need onChange method for non-standard event.

we look for `e.target.value` && `e.target.type` and MUI select missing `type`

Sorry, I didn't get it. Is this intended behavior?

Also onChange method of Controller is called with rather "strange" value. For now sticking with 4.9.8 version

This is intended behaviour, to solve all issue with target event.

if an event is in a sharp of `{ value: 'test', id: 'test' }` it shouldn't be considered as a proper target to retrieve its value. the previous commit fix this problem, MUI select is return an event without `type`, so RHF can not read the `value` out it, so should you use `onChange` in Controller.

> Also onChange method of Controller is called with rather "strange" value. For now sticking with 4.9.8 version

you can stick that version. it's your choice.

issue.title: Add a way to skip Contorller#commonTask getInputValue() call

repository.name: react-hook-form
repository.description: ðŸ“‹ React Hooks for form state management and validation (Web + React Native)

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

When use Controller with custom input, If the value object is {id:1, value:"ABC"}, controller will set next value to "ABC" because getInputValue will try to get obj.value first. Should it be {id:1, value:"ABC"}? 

https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/blob/master/src/controller.tsx#L59
and 
https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/blob/master/src/logic/getInputValue.ts#L13


**Describe the solution you'd like**

Maybe we should only call `getInputValue` if `value` is an `SyntheticEvent` object? Can we rely on constructor check?
```tsx
if (e.constructor.name === "SyntheticEvent" && e.type === "change") {
  console.log("input change event");
}
```

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

Or can we add an option to skip it?

body: hey @NurbekGithub your issue report is valid! sorry that was my bad, i am applying a fix.
Oh, I was just wondering why docs examples are not working. Happy to know that i can update now. Greate lib and awesome support. Thanks a lot! :star2:
